description: 3rd grade teacher Aoki Daisuke didn't expect the first class he ever taught to be one of the toughest obstacles of his life. After getting off on the wrong foot with the entire class, a moment of kind-heartedness instantly convinces one of his students, Rin Kokonoe, to make the ill-fated Aoki-sensei her lover. But what exactly are Rin's intentions for wanting to actively seduce Aoki-sensei, and will Aoki-sensei be able to help her to deal with them?

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Psychosexual
tags.description: Work that involves the psychological aspects of sexual impulses.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Incest
tags.description: Features sexual or romantic relations between characters who are related by blood.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

node.description:
__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Website](https://erikitamura.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KITAxERI) | [King Records](http://king-cr.jp/artist/kitaeri/)

A Japanese voice actress and singer. She used to be a child actress by the name of Eri Okamura. 

She is primarily known for her role in Blood+ as Saya Otonashi and singing "Tsuyogari," the third ending for the anime series Konjiki No Gash Bell!! She is also known to be an amateur manga artist in Japan in her spare time. Kitamura is affiliated with talent agency Early Wing and was formerly affiliated with Kaleidoscope.

Currently works in the music unit ARTERY VEIN with Asami Imai. Also provides the voice of CUL, a Vocaloid.

__[Website](https://akihata.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/akihata_jp) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akihata.jp/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/AKIHATAjp)__

__Aki Hata__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).

Aspired to become an animator when he saw [Macross: Do You Remember Love?](https://anilist.co/anime/1089/), while in elementary school. He studied art in middle school and high school, and later enrolled to a university with an animation department. There he was set on either moving to the United States or Japan to study abroad, and ended up choosing Japan due to how popular hand-drawn animation was there. After moving to Japan and graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology and Arts, he joined [Studio Comet](https://anilist.co/studio/126/) in 2005 and began his career in the industry.

He later joined [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) after getting scouted out by the studio's founder, [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/).

Debuted as a director in 2017 with [Garo: Vanishing Line](https://anilist.co/anime/99796/).

In March 2021 he established the [E&H Production](https://anilist.co/studio/7229) studio becoming its Representative.

[Website](http://chanekino.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/chanekino) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chata) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/茶太)

A Japanese singer who has performed theme songs for games and anime. She has also participated in various doujin music circles. Her own private circle is called Usagi Kinoko.

__[Profile (diosta)](https://diosta.jp/creators/nishi-ken/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/n_nishiken_k)__

__Birthplace:__ Kanazawa CIty, Ishikawa Prefecture, Japan
__Height:__ 182cm
__Shoe Size:__ 28~28.5cm

__Kentarou Nishida__, better known as Nishi-Ken (stylized as nishi-ken), is a Japanese keyboardist, guitarist, organist, sound producer, remixer, lyricist, composer and arranger.

__[Blog (JP)](http://forte-piano.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nijine)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Nana Prefectural Sakurai Senior High School (2001), Osaka College of Music (2004)

__Introduction:__
Akito Matsuda, also known by his alias Nijine, is a Japanese composer and arranger. He worked freelance as a composer and arranger until his employment with Popholic found place in 2007.

__Biography:__
Akito is mainly known for working under the name Nijine, which he did between 2006 through 2012, where he wrote the soundtracks for a handful of anime while also composing and arranging various anime songs. In 2013, he decided to start using his real name for his work instead. He is also known for working on several eroge soundtracks and vocal songs under the name Tokia (stylized as TOKIA) early on in his career.
Released her first single "Jump up!" on August 24, 2005.

__[Blog (JP)](http://forte-piano.net/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nijine)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan
__Graduated:__ Nana Prefectural Sakurai Senior High School (2001), Osaka College of Music (2004)

__Introduction:__
Akito Matsuda, also known by his alias Nijine, is a Japanese composer and arranger. He worked freelance as a composer and arranger until his employment with Popholic found place in 2007.

__Biography:__
Akito is mainly known for working under the name Nijine, which he did between 2006 through 2012, where he wrote the soundtracks for a handful of anime while also composing and arranging various anime songs. In 2013, he decided to start using his real name for his work instead. He is also known for working on several eroge soundtracks and vocal songs under the name Tokia (stylized as TOKIA) early on in his career.
__Tomokazu Tashiro__ is a Japanese composer, arranger and member of the music production team [Q-MHz](https://anilist.co/staff/156926/QMHz).

A Japanese singer who has performed theme songs for games and anime. She has also participated in various doujin music circles. Her own private circle is called Usagi Kinoko.
